HISTORY: ColdFusion MX 6.1: Changed behavior for the name attribute: cfheader name="Content-Disposition" uses the default file character encoding to encode this header’s value, so the name of a file can include characters in the character encoding used in the file.
SYNTAX:
<cfheader charset="character set" name = "header name" value = "header value"> OR <cfheader statusCode = "status code" statusText = "status text">
Note: You can specify this tag’s attributes in an attributeCollection attribute whose value is a structure. Specify the structure name in the attributeCollection attribute and use the tag’s attribute names as structure keys.
CATEGORY: Data output tags, Page processing tags
SEEALSO: cfcache, cfflush, cfhtmlhead, cfinclude, cfsetting, cfsilent, cfcontent
DESCRIPTION: Generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client.
EXAMPLE: <h3>cfheader Example</h3> <p>cfheader generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client. <p>This example forces browser client to purge its cache of requested file. <cfheader name="Expires" value="#GetHttpTimeString(Now())#">
USAGE: If you use this tag after the cfflush tag on a page, an error is thrown.

Attribute.DESCRIPTION: The character encoding in which to encode the header value. The following list includes commonly used values: utf-8 iso-8859-1 windows-1252 us-ascii shift_jis iso-2022-jp euc-jp euc-kr big5 euc-cn utf-16 For more information about character encodings, see www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
